question.title: How to remove PII from MessageHandlingException in Spring Integration?
question.body:
I am trying to remove PII from logs. Is there some way to tell spring integration not to include the payload and header in the exceptions.

public Message<?> hasErrorAndPii(Message<?> message) throws Exception {
      
   if(1==1)
       throw new Exception("Example");
        
   return MessageBuilder.withPayload("Example")
        .build();
        
}

Output Example:

org.springframework.messaging.MessageHandlingException: error occurred during processing message in 'MethodInvokingMessageProcessor' [org.springframework.integration.handler.MethodInvokingMessageProcessor@5494e631], failedMessage=GenericMessage [payload=hasPII, headers={hasPII}]

Edit:

Got down voted, but I think this is an important issue. Maybe some more info will help.

The payload and headers often have business data, which is often pii. So for every exception with GenericMessage, the headers and message get dumped into the log.

Justified or not, I think this is widespread notion, about keeping PII out of logs. However, I don't think spring integration really supports it.

GC_
